para: Select &skel; &elems; whose &material; is named by the material parameter. An &elem;'s &material; is the &material; assigned to the dominant pixel in the set of µ pixels underlying the &elem;.

In the GUI, the pull down menu for the material parameter includes all of the defined &materials; as well as the strings <Any> and <None>. If material is set to '<None>', then &elems; with no &material; will be selected. This can happen only if there are pixels in the µ with no assigned &material;. If material is '<Any>', then &elems; with any &material; will be selected. Choosing &elems; with '<Any>' is exactly like choosing them with '<None>' and then Inverting the selection.
